title: How to Create SEO Location Pages For Your Website (That Actually RANK!)

tactics.name: Keyword Research for Location Prioritization
tactics.description: Identify high-demand locations using keyword data to prioritize pages that align with user intent and market size.
steps: Conduct keyword research to assess search volume and demand for specific locations
Focus on winnable keywords rather than just high-volume terms
source_quotes: Keyword research can help you prioritize which location pages to build.

tactics.name: Keyword Variation Strategy
tactics.description: Use multiple keyword variations on a single location page to capture diverse search intent while maintaining low competition.
steps: Research location-specific keywords with search volume between 20-100
Prioritize keywords with KD difficulty below 40 for local businesses
source_quotes: You might want to include that keyword on your list of keywords for that location page that you're making just to try and capture all the traffic that you can.

tactics.name: Title Structure with Service + Location
tactics.description: Use a clear, keyword-rich title format to signal location intent and improve rankings
source_quotes: Your title follows the format of the main service or main keyword plus the location you're offering it in.

tactics.name: Local Context in Introduction
tactics.description: Highlight location-specific services and unique offerings early to signal local relevance and expertise.
steps: Create a section explaining how services differ by location
source_quotes: putting that near the top of the page is also going to be something important

tactics.name: Service Section with Local Keywords
tactics.description: List core services with location-specific keyword variations to reinforce local intent.
steps: Create a section for core services
Incorporate location names into service titles (e.g., 'Utah Local SEO')
source_quotes: we do local SEO for Utah companies

heuristics.name: Prioritize High-Demand Locations
heuristics.condition: If a location shows high search volume for service terms, then allocate resources to create a page
source_quotes: Focus on locations with enough demand to justify the cost of creating that page.

heuristics.name: Unique Content Requirement
heuristics.condition: If a location page contains duplicated or generic content, penalize
source_quotes: Each location page for SEO that you make has to be unique and it has to deliver on what makes your company special...

heuristics.name: Single H1 per Page
heuristics.condition: If a page has multiple H1 tags, prioritize the primary location keyword
source_quotes: You only want one of those per page. Every other heading you have on this page will be an H2 or an H3 structure.

heuristics.name: Location-Specific Service Prioritization
heuristics.condition: If a service is offered in a specific location, prioritize it in the service section
source_quotes: you can see right here we have a list of kind of our main services

claims.statement: Location pages help Google understand service-area context for local businesses
source_quotes: Creating a location-specific page on your website is one of the most concrete ways to build context with Google.

claims.statement: Local businesses benefit from lower competition when targeting location-specific keywords
source_quotes: The difficulty is going to be lower just by nature of you even doing this at all. You're going to have a major advantage on your competitors.

claims.statement: National companies can benefit from local location pages when targeting specific markets
source_quotes: Even though we're a national company, we went ahead and made some local pages for it.

claims.statement: Including location-specific services in the introduction improves local search rankings
source_quotes: this gives additional context to Google about who you are

claims.statement: Internal linking between location pages and service pages strengthens SEO authority
source_quotes: these pages are in fact important

niche_patterns.description: Target specific services in defined geographic areas to align with user search intent
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Combines service intent with location-based queries, reducing competition while increasing relevance
source_quotes: Focus on the actual search terms that you can win rather than just the highest search volume keywords.

niche_patterns.description: Target specific service-location combinations to capture hyper-local intent
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Users searching for service + location combinations have clear intent and lower competition
source_quotes: HVAC St. George. This is interesting. Let's say my company is in Salt Lake City... St. George is actually in southern Utah...

niche_patterns.description: Target specific services in geographic locations to capture local intent
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Aligns with user search behavior for localized services
source_quotes: These are all extremely relevant terms to us.

niche_patterns.description: Combine service type with specific location to target hyper-local intent
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Matches user intent for location-specific services with high commercial value
source_quotes: we do local SEO for Utah companies
